messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2854
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/12/2003 9:15:21 PM Central Standard Time, ... I m sorry, but this really isn t the place for an abortion debate, is it? But, to answer
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/12/2003 9:15:21 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Why not respect the most helpless of all children--the
> unborn?
>

I'm sorry, but this really isn't the place for an abortion debate, is it?

But, to answer your question as respectfully as possible (and then say no
more! ;-), I don't consider a fetus to be a "child", therefore your question
doesn't affect my views on abortion OR on unschooling.

Becky

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president, or that we are
to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and
servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public."
--Theodore Roosevelt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
